questions.text: Were you ever depressed or down, or felt sad, empty or hopeless most of the day, nearly every day, for two weeks?
For the past two weeks, were you depressed or down, or felt sad, empty or hopeless most of the day, nearly every day?
Were you ever much less interested in most things or much less able to enjoy the things you used to enjoy most of the time, for two weeks?
In the past two weeks, were you much less interested in most things or much less able to enjoy the things you used to enjoy most of the time?
During that two-week period, was your appetite decreased or increased nearly every day, or did your weight change significantly without trying?
Did you have trouble sleeping nearly every night (difficulty falling asleep, early-morning waking, or sleeping excessively)?
Did you talk or move more slowly than normal, or were you fidgety, restless or unable to sit still almost every day (and did anyone notice)?
Did you feel tired or without energy almost every day?
Did you feel worthless or guilty almost every day?
Did you have difficulty concentrating, thinking or making decisions almost every day?
Did you repeatedly think about death, have thoughts or plans of killing yourself, or attempt suicide?
Did these symptoms cause significant distress or problems at home, work, school, socially, or in other important areas, and represent a change from your previous functioning?
Between depressive episodes, did you ever have an interval of at least two months without significant depression or loss of interest?
How many episodes of depression have you had in your lifetime? (There must be at least two months between episodes without significant depression.)
